programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.sub-title: Art of the Impressionists and Beyond
programme.desc: The late-1800s saw old notions of beauty challenged by artists. We enjoy pioneering Impressionist works like Monet’s lilies, Renoir’s ladies, and Rodin’s statues. We trace the tempestuous travels of Van Gogh through his incomparable art.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: As we get to know Copenhagen, we’ll discover reminders of its Viking history.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: The land of the Basque people is split between France and Spain. With a stubborn spirit and an industrious nature, the Basques celebrate this rich heritage while embracing the future.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: Focusing on the grandeur of classical Rome, we'll marvel at the Colosseum, Pantheon, and Capitoline Museum before heading out on a bike ride along the ancient Appian Way.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Starting in vibrantly gritty Glasgow, we'll tap into Scottish passions as we tour Stirling Castle, have a wee dram on the Speyside Whisky Trail, and watch a sheepdog demonstration.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Italy's ultimate charms survive in its hill towns: San Gimignano and Orvieto.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Three local Tijuana foodies take Rick on a taco crawl. Experience arrachera tacos, suadero tacos, sauteed and fried shrimp tacos, steamed tacos, and smoked salmon tacos. At home, Rick creates a taco feast for a casual backyard cookout.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Rick's having people over for a relaxed evening of parlor games, and he has set himself a challenge: in one hour, with one bag of groceries, he must prepare a big-flavored spread of Mexican party food. The secret is all in the ingredients.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Sure, there are great male chefs in Mexico. But women are the true mothers of this cuisine. From market cafes to hip new white-tablecloth restaurants, the cuisine of Mexico comes from a rich tradition of hearth, home, and women's hands.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Over a beautiful plate of food in the kitchen of his white-tablecloth restaurant, Topolobampo, Rick muses on the idea of culinary muses.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Tequila has come around, from "lick the salt and suck the lime" firewater, to chic drink of connoisseurs and hipsters alike.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Rick and his daughter, Lanie, check out Mexico's real-life superhero subculture: the surreal, splashy world of Lucha Libre. The beloved masked wrestling phenomenon captured all of Mexico's imagination and became embraced by its' culture.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: Anthropologist Anne-Sylvie Malbrancke journeys to meet Jenny, a young Peruvian who has crossed the country to ask the sacred lakes to heal her medical issue. For more than 700 years, shamans have drawn their power to heal from the Huaringas, sacred lagoons located on the border of Peru and Ecuador.

programme.title: Welcome to My Strange City
programme.desc: Welcome to Ganvie, land of the unsubdued, the free, the resistance, and of peaceful waters. In Ganvie, the Tofinu people live on the water. To do so they must move at a careful pace, learn to live without excess, and form deep bonds of family and friendship to survive.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Meet the people of America's national parks who help preserve our monuments and conserve our park's beauty. They rappel down the towering granite faces of Mount Rushmore, they execute prescribed burns in the Grand Canyon, and they plow the treacherous Going-to-the-Sun Road in Glacier National Park.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: Best Parks for Jaw Dropping Scenery
programme.desc: See Mother Nature at its best. From the highest waterfall to the one of the biggest holes in the world, it's this kind of scenery that will make you stop in your tracks.

programme.title: Canada's National Parks
programme.desc: The vibrant city of Vancouver blends the call of the wild with big city charm. Tour historic Gastown and the Capilano Suspension Bridge. Vancouver Island's capital city, Victoria, defines itself by all things British. Experience ziptrek flights through treetops, and cruise Alaska's Inside Passage.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Cape Town is a nexus of cultures in a setting so stunning it is called "Africa's Riviera." Where else in the world can you wake up in a cosmopolitan city, spend the afternoon with penguins, ride a funicular to the edge of the continent, and watch the sun set from a beach with a glass of wine?

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Explore the island of Kyushu with it's dramatic landscape and hot sands, and discover the essence of Japanese cuisine with Daisuke Utagawa and Rudy Maxa.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Two of the most unique cities in the world are just north of New England. Here you will find brie, pate, jewel box-patisseries, and "s'il vous plait" right along with bagels, maple syrup, hockey, delis, and bocce ball. Those who forged Montreal and Quebec City braved much to see them flourish.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Portugal & Southwest France: Visiting his boss's family farm, Tony helps slaughter and feast on a pig the family has been fattening all year. Then, Tony heads to France to experience the rich delights of a foie gras farm.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Cambodia: With a friend along for the ride, Tony travels to Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where he explores a food culture that is both pleasing to the palette and slightly frightening.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: No Beads, No Babes, No Bourbon Street
programme.desc: In New Orleans, Louisiana, Tony catches a Bayou alligator, cools off with a world-famous snow cone, gets in trouble with the law, eats jambalaya with a dancing chef, and relaxes to some local jazz.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Arcachon, France: Here, Bourdain first learned to love food as a child. Returning for a trip down memory lane, Tony enjoys childhood staples, including steak frites, gaufres (waffles), soupe de pecheur (fisherman's soup) and fresh oysters.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Puebla, Where the Good Cooks Are From
programme.desc: Puebla, Mexico: According to Tony, the best line cooks in NYC come from Mexico, so he travels to the Puebla, and enjoys mole sauces, toasted ant eggs, fried worms, and the legendary pulque (a slightly hallucinogenic drink made from cactus sap).

programme.title: WaterVoyagers - Chinese Adventures
programme.desc: The food in China is fabulous with something for everyone.

programme.title: Discovering the World
programme.desc: For 200 million years, Madagascar has been isolated as an island, giving life that calls this island home a chance to develop in its' own unique fashion. Mighty volcanoes, freshwater rivers, and primary forests make up a captivating setting home to rich biodiversity specific only to this location.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: Holy Week is among the most important rituals in Christianity. The week before Easter, Holy Week celebrates the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. In Seville, Spain, from Palm Sunday to Easter Sunday, dozens of processions take place, each one led by one of the 60 brotherhoods in the city.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.desc: Get "a touch of the tundra" as you take in Denali's stunning scenery through the dome-roofed cars of the Denali Star train, meet sled dogs at the Kennels, and take a discovery hike to experience the untamed wilderness and diverse wildlife much as the first explorers to the region once did.

programme.title: Inside America's National Parks
programme.desc: Grand Teton National Park is a geological wonder, a hiker's paradise, and an irresistible lure for thrill seekers and wildlife enthusiasts. Climb a sheer cliff wall, raft a raging river, visit an avalanche lab, join a search and rescue team, work a dude ranch, and rough it at posh retreats.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: Best Parks for the Rise and Fall
programme.desc: This episode features two main attractions: beautiful sunrises and amazing waterfalls. You'll never find more stunning places for rises and falls.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: The annual Dancer of the Year Competition in The Cook Islands helps preserve and pass down important aspects of Polynesian culture. On this island paradise, Mickela goes behind-the-scenes at this highly competitive, local tradition.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: The passionate dance and music of flamenco envelopes their world as Mickela soaks in Seville, Spain. First, Mickela dines at one of the oldest tapas bars in Seville before receiving instruction from legendary dancer, Cristina Hoyos.

programme.title: Moments in Time with Elia Locardi
programme.desc: Elia photographs some of his favorite locations in Kyoto, Nara, and Osaka beginning with the Fushimi Inari Shrine. Later, he joins landscape photographer Hideaki Sumi at Osaka Castle to photograph the cherry blossoms framing the castle.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.sub-title: Evia: An Island Hiding in Plain Sight
programme.desc: Evia is a culinary utopia, home to great seafood, a long-standing shepherding tradition, ancient spas, and snow-capped mountains. Here, Diane walks with a local mushroom expert, and is inspired to cook with some unique earthly delights.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.sub-title: Naxos: Meat and Potatoes Like You've Never Had 'em
programme.desc: Naxos is famed for the quality of its meats, its seductive array of cheeses, and its potatoes. From the Mediterranean shore Diane and Alexis travel to a remote mountain hideaway where a pair of local cooks await with a classic Naxos feast.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: So-Cal grilling boasts bold California flavors, hot fire, and wood smoke.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Before grills, there was fire!

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: If it tastes good baked, fried, or boiled, it is even better grilled.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Learn to turn pastrami, lamb and pork belly into gastronomic miracles.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: The melting pot extreme, traditional American BBQ meets ethnic grilling.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Steven shows grilling from whole fish to shellfish.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Oaxaca, Mexico: Chef Tony Bourdain explores the exotic and colorful indigenous zone of Mexico's Oaxaca region where he tastes toasted grasshoppers and other delicacies. His adventure ends with mariachi music and, of course, lots of tequila.
